summary: Gene R. Johnson was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). His name appears on multiple payroll and certification reports spanning from April 1978 to January 1979. These documents list his name, social security number, position, salary, and employment dates within the SCAS. The documents suggest he was a staff member during the later stages of the committee's work.
significance: Gene R. Johnson's significance lies in his employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating his involvement in the investigation of the JFK assassination, though the specific nature and extent of his role are not detailed in these documents.
